item.description: It took a bit longer than usual this time, but after 10 minutes I again became extremely annoyed by the German media‚Äôs infatuation with the British monarchy

item.description:
Frequently we bike through Camp Reinsehlen, a former German airfield and British military training base near Schneverdingen. Everything is pretty much torn down, but in the middle of a now empty field is a sign commentating Queen Elizabeth II who visited the camp in 1967. #RIP

Wikipedia on Camp Reinsehlen. The Dalai Lama had also visited. https://t.co/POWWBm6Wmu
item.source:markdown:
Frequently we bike through Camp Reinsehlen, a former German airfield and British military training base near Schneverdingen. Everything is pretty much torn down, but in the middle of a now empty field is a sign commentating Queen Elizabeth II who visited the camp in 1967. #RIP
Wikipedia on Camp Reinsehlen. The Dalai Lama had also visited. https://t.co/POWWBm6Wmu

item.description: Thanks to all for the well wishes. We had a wonderful dinner at a Landgasthof last night, although we managed to forget the gift certificate we intended to use to pay as well as an EC card as backup. Cash saved the day! https://t.co/C5DnOhMWKO

item.description:
@RealMarkDziak No, although it would be appropriate. She had arrived in the US a few weeks before, fresh out of Gymnasium on a fianc√©e visa. She went to work as crew at McD (until she could find a real job). Our first stop after the courthouse was to see her boss for free breakfast.

@RealMarkDziak Then (the romantics that we were) we took another city bus to the INS office in St. Paul to prove we have fulfilled the terms of her visa and apply for a green card. üòÉ
item.source:markdown:
@RealMarkDziak No, although it would be appropriate. She had arrived in the US a few weeks before, fresh out of Gymnasium on a fianc√©e visa. She went to work as crew at McD (until she could find a real job). Our first stop after the courthouse was to see her boss for free breakfast.
@RealMarkDziak Then (the romantics that we were) we took another city bus to the INS office in St. Paul to prove we have fulfilled the terms of her visa and apply for a green card. üòÉ

item.description:
Thirty-nine years ago today, on the day after Labor Day, we took an MTC bus to downtown Minneapolis. We went to the Hennepin County Government Center and walked into the courtroom of Judge Susanne C. Sedgwick. When we came out we were married.

Here‚Äôs a look at our life in 1983 (she just posted it to Facebook, so it‚Äôs public knowledge now) https://t.co/N4CzElAINN

Note the milk crate telephone stand, poor students‚Äô 80s equivalent of IKEA!
item.source:markdown:
Thirty-nine years ago today, on the day after Labor Day, we took an MTC bus to downtown Minneapolis. We went to the Hennepin County Government Center and walked into the courtroom of Judge Susanne C. Sedgwick. When we came out we were married.
Here‚Äôs a look at our life in 1983 (she just posted it to Facebook, so it‚Äôs public knowledge now) https://t.co/N4CzElAINN
Note the milk crate telephone stand, poor students‚Äô 80s equivalent of IKEA!

item.description: @c0urtneyH Our last station in the US was Arizona for 18 months and we loved the weather. I still vote there after 30 years away.
item.source:markdown: @c0urtneyH Our last station in the US was Arizona for 18 months and we loved the weather. I still vote there after 30 years away.

item.description: @StandingTeacher @swaggoner @ClaireSmith1848 Just saying, our panels were installed last December with -20¬∞C and icy Dachpfannen. We didn‚Äôt have to pay extra for dangerous working conditions! üòõ
item.source:markdown: @StandingTeacher @swaggoner @ClaireSmith1848 Just saying, our panels were installed last December with -20¬∞C and icy Dachpfannen. We didn‚Äôt have to pay extra for dangerous working conditions! üòõ

item.description:
@techman53 That‚Äôs a lot of questions at one time! üòÄ I was motivated to not be dependent on my wife for German daily life. And without internet I had to inform myself and solve my problems in German. It took about 3 years to become truly competent in the language, though.

@techman53 I grew up in Minnesota and met my wife when she was an exchange student in high school. We married 3 years later and lived in the US 7 years before moving to Germany (for a career opportunity for her). I had visited Germany a few times so I knew what I was getting into.
item.source:markdown:
@techman53 That‚Äôs a lot of questions at one time! üòÄ I was motivated to not be dependent on my wife for German daily life. And without internet I had to inform myself and solve my problems in German. It took about 3 years to become truly competent in the language, though.
@techman53 I grew up in Minnesota and met my wife when she was an exchange student in high school. We married 3 years later and lived in the US 7 years before moving to Germany (for a career opportunity for her). I had visited Germany a few times so I knew what I was getting into.
